content:
Hyena and Raven
 An Nduku 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena and Raven were once great 
 friends, even though they were quite 
 diferent in some ways. 
 
 Raven could fly but Hyena was only able 
 to walk. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day Hyena, curious to know 
 
 something about his friend, asked Raven,
 “What is this white thing which is always
 below your neck?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Raven answered, “It is the faty meat which I usualy eat in the sky. I have
 
 ben eating it for so long now it is stuck on my neck.” 
 
 
 On hearing about meat, saliva started pouring out of Hyena’s mouth for he
 was gredy and he loved meat very much. 
 
 
 Hyena realy wanted to eat that meat. But how could he reach the meat in
 the sky if he had no wings to fly? 
 
 
 “Please my friend,” he asked Raven, “lend me some feathers so that I can
 make myself some wings. I realy want to be able to fly like you.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Raven was not mean, so he gave him 
 some feathers. 
 Hyena sewed them together into wings. 
 
 He fastened them to his body, and tried 
 to take of into the sky. 
 But he was far to heavy for the few 
 
 feathers to cary him. 
 So he had to think of another plan. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Please my friend,” he asked Raven,
 “could I hold onto your tail as you fly up
 
 into the sky?” 
 “Al right,” said Raven. “I know how much
 you want to fly. Let’s do it tomorow
 
 morning.” 
 When day came, Hyena tok hold of
 
 Raven’s tail and Raven flew up into the
 sky. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Raven flew and flew and flew until he 
 was exhausted. But Hyena said, “Just a 
 
 litle further, my friend!” 
 He could se the white and faty meat 
 just above them, and his mouth was 
 
 watering. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When they reached the first piece of faty meat, Hyena felt a jerk. One of
 
 Raven’s tail feathers came of in his hand! Then there was another jerk, and
 another. Raven felt much lighter, and the ache in his tail was going.
 
 
 He sang: 
 Raven’s feathers, unpluck yourselves. Raven’s feathers, unpluck yourselves.
 
 
 In response, Hyena sang the oposite: 
 Raven’s feathers hold on, don’t unpluck yourselves. Raven’s feathers hold on,
 
 don’t unpluck yourselves. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Finaly, the feathers could not hold Hyena
 
 anymore. He was in the midle of
 nowhere in the sky. 
 He jumped onto the faty meat thinking
 
 that as he ate, the faty meat would hold
 him. But as he tried to hold and eat the
 
 ‘meat’, al he felt was moist cloud!
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 By now he was faling fast. “Help, help!” 
 
 he shouted. 
 But no one could hear him. Raven was 
 lost in the clouds. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena fel on the ground with a crash
 and lay silent for some minutes.
 He woke up howling in pain, with a
 
 broken leg and dark scars al over his
 body. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 From that day to now, Hyena limps and 
 
 he has many scars on his body. 
 He has never ben able to fly. 
 And he and Raven are no longer friends. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12
